articles.author: Ari Rabinovitch, Stephanie Kelly
articles.description: Israel recovered the bodies of six hostages from a tunnel in southern Gaza where they were apparently killed not long before Israeli troops reached them, the military said on Sunday.
articles.title: Israel recovers bodies of six hostages in Gaza, including Goldberg-Polin

articles.author: Pavel Polityuk
articles.description: Kyiv launched one of the biggest drone attacks on Russia since the full-scale war began, targeting power plants and an oil refinery overnight, while Moscow's forces made further advances towards a key town in eastern Ukraine, officials said on Sunday.
articles.title: Ukraine launches mass drone attack on Russia, loses more ground in east

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The AfD was on track to become the first far-right party to win a regional election in Germany since World War Two, but was almost certain to be excluded from power by rival parties.
articles.title: Far-right regional election win spells setback for Germany's Scholz

articles.author: Nailia Bagirova
articles.description: Azerbaijan's ruling party was on course for a single-seat majority on Sunday in a snap parliamentary election called by President Ilham Aliyev, according to an exit poll.
articles.title: Azerbaijan's ruling party on course for one-seat majority in election, exit poll says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: "We are getting body bags instead of a deal," the union's leader said.
articles.title: Israel's main labor union calls general strike on Monday

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: At least two Israelis were killed when their vehicle was fired on near the city of Hebron in the occupied West Bank, Israeli officials said on Sunday.
articles.title: At least two Israelis killed in West Bank shooting attack, medics say

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Israeli Defence Minister Yoav Gallant urged Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu on Sunday to conclude a ceasefire deal with Hamas to bring the remaining hostages home from Gaza, as the bodies of six of those taken on Oct. 7 were brought home.
articles.title: Israeli defence minister calls for deal to bring Gaza hostages home

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: He dismissed Trump's assertion that he could quickly end the war.
articles.title: Kremlin spokesman says Harris is more predictable than Trump

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Mourners lit candles and placed icons on Sunday beneath photographs of the schoolchildren, teachers and parents who died 20 years ago when Islamist gunmen staged the deadliest militant attack in modern Russian history.
articles.title: Survivors and families mark 20 years since Russia's Beslan school siege

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: One civilian was killed and four others injured in Russian shelling overnight on Ukraine's Sumy region on the border between the two warring countries, the local Ukrainian administration said on Sunday.
articles.title: One killed, four injured in Russian shelling of Sumy region, Ukraine says
